column1: #FORMAT=WebAnno TSV 3.2
#T_SP=webanno.custom.Referent|entity|infstat
#T_RL=webanno.custom.Coref|type|BT_webanno.custom.Referent
#Text=FOREWORD
#Text=It cannot be said that the Everhard Manuscript is an important historical document .
#Text=To the historian it bristles with errors -- not errors of fact , but errors of interpretation .

#Text=Looking back across the seven centuries that have lapsed since Avis Everhard completed her manuscript , events , and the bearings of events , that were confused and veiled to her , are clear to us .
#Text=She lacked perspective .
#Text=She was too close to the events she writes about .
#Text=Nay , she was merged in the events she has described .
#Text=Nevertheless , as a personal document , the Everhard Manuscript is of inestimable value .
#Text=But here again enter error of perspective , and vitiation due to the bias of love .
#Text=Yet we smile , indeed , and forgive Avis Everhard for the heroic lines upon which she modelled her husband .
#Text=We know to-day that he was not so colossal , and that he loomed among the events of his times less largely than the Manuscript would lead us to believe .
#Text=We know that Ernest Everhard was an exceptionally strong man , but not so exceptional as his wife thought him to be .

#Text=He was , after all , but one of a large number of heroes who , throughout the world , devoted their lives to the Revolution ; though it must be conceded that he did unusual work , especially in his elaboration and interpretation of working-class philosophy .

#Text=“ Proletarian science ” and “ proletarian philosophy ” were his phrases for it , and therein he shows the provincialism of his mind -- a defect , however , that was due to the times and that none in that day could escape .
#Text=But to return to the Manuscript .
#Text=Especially valuable is it in communicating to us the FEEL of those terrible times .

#Text=Nowhere do we find more vividly portrayed the psychology of the persons that lived in that turbulent period embraced between the years 1912 and 1932 -- their mistakes and ignorance , their doubts and fears and misapprehensions , their ethical delusions , their violent passions , their inconceivable sordidness and selfishness .
#Text=These are the things that are so hard for us of this enlightened age to understand .
#Text=History tells us that these things were , and biology and psychology tell us why they were ; but history and biology and psychology do not make these things alive .
#Text=We accept them as facts , but we are left without sympathetic comprehension of them .
#Text=This sympathy comes to us , however , as we peruse the Everhard Manuscript .
#Text=We enter into the minds of the actors in that long-ago world-drama , and for the time being their mental processes are our mental processes .
#Text=Not alone do we understand Avis Everhard 's love for her hero-husband , but we feel , as he felt , in those first days , the vague and terrible loom of the Oligarchy .
#Text=The Iron Heel ( well named ) we feel descending upon and crushing mankind .
#Text=And in passing we note that that historic phrase , the Iron Heel , originated in Ernest Everhard 's mind .
#Text=This , we may say , is the one moot question that this new-found document clears up .
#Text=Previous to this , the earliest-known use of the phrase occurred in the pamphlet , “ Ye Slaves , ” written by George Milford and published in December , 1912 .

#Text=This George Milford was an obscure agitator about whom nothing is known , save the one additional bit of information gained from the Manuscript , which mentions that he was shot in the Chicago Commune .
#Text=Evidently he had heard Ernest Everhard make use of the phrase in some public speech , most probably when he was running for Congress in the fall of 1912 .
#Text=From the Manuscript we learn that Everhard used the phrase at a private dinner in the spring of 1912 .
#Text=This is , without discussion , the earliest-known occasion on which the Oligarchy was so designated .
#Text=The rise of the Oligarchy will always remain a cause of secret wonder to the historian and the philosopher .
#Text=Other great historical events have their place in social evolution .
#Text=They were inevitable .
#Text=Their coming could have been predicted with the same certitude that astronomers to-day predict the outcome of the movements of stars .
#Text=Without these other great historical events , social evolution could not have proceeded .
#Text=Primitive communism , chattel slavery , serf slavery , and wage slavery were necessary stepping-stones in the evolution of society .
#Text=But it were ridiculous to assert that the Iron Heel was a necessary stepping-stone .
#Text=Rather , to-day , is it adjudged a step aside , or a step backward , to the social tyrannies that made the early world a hell , but that were as necessary as the Iron Heel was unnecessary .
#Text=Black as Feudalism was , yet the coming of it was inevitable .
#Text=What else than Feudalism could have followed upon the breakdown of that great centralized governmental machine known as the Roman Empire ?
#Text=Not so , however , with the Iron Heel .
#Text=In the orderly procedure of social evolution there was no place for it .
#Text=It was not necessary , and it was not inevitable .

#Text=It must always remain the great curiosity of history -- a whim , a fantasy , an apparition , a thing unexpected and undreamed ; and it should serve as a warning to those rash political theorists of to-day who speak with certitude of social processes .
#Text=Capitalism was adjudged by the sociologists of the time to be the culmination of bourgeois rule , the ripened fruit of the bourgeois revolution .
#Text=And we of to-day can but applaud that judgment .
#Text=Following upon Capitalism , it was held , even by such intellectual and antagonistic giants as Herbert Spencer , that Socialism would come .
#Text=Out of the decay of self-seeking capitalism , it was held , would arise that flower of the ages , the Brotherhood of Man .
#Text=Instead of which , appalling alike to us who look back and to those that lived at the time , capitalism , rotten-ripe , sent forth that monstrous offshoot , the Oligarchy .
